title: Use HELP Position to Prevent Hypothermia in Water
brief: Assume Heat Escaping Lessening Posture to retain body heat when floating with life preserver.
steps: Step 1: Put on life preserver and remain still in water.
Step 2: Assume fetal position to help retain body heat.
Step 3: Keep head out of water - you lose about 50% of body heat through your head.
Step 4: Protect other high heat-loss areas: neck, sides, and groin.
Step 5: Remain in HELP position until rescue or until reaching shore.
warnings: Heat exchange rate in water is about 25 times greater than in air of same temperature.
Hypothermia occurs rapidly in cold water due to decreased insulation of wet clothing.
Water displaces the layer of still air that normally surrounds your body.
